February 13, 2021
Phoenix_Icewing
Well, if you're willing to invest 50 points total, that gives you all 4, with +1 to all stats, And except for the bystander, all sidekicks with Fantastic Four keyword. [inlinedial]ffff011[/inlinedial] [inlinedial]ffff026[/inlinedial] [inlinedial]ffff038bt[/inlinedial] Since Tongs power up says listed characters, even the bystander gets a boost even if hes not a sidekick. But, this let's you bring out Turg, Hss for 2 with a 10 AV, let alone the victim you speed through, then next turn (with the new no damage pushing), do it twice. Do it the first time, remove him from the map since he wasnt generated that turn, he comes back with no tokens, and go again, and next turn twice, etc. And since that's free to remove and resummon him, all Korr has to do is position and stealth, and his willpower gives him potential for extra actions, which equates mobility. Mik becomes an 11 AV for 3 damage with EW. You could also toss in the Thing Robot and the Ally/Leader 30 pt Doom for defend (and bonus against other F4 teams) to round a hundred, let alone all the other leader bonuses available. Potential is extremely strong with this set in general.
February 11, 2021
Goop
So Korr here by himself is pretty terrible, its really the Turg token thats good. A token that can zip around doing 1dmg without even having to hit is pretty nice. Especially for only 25 points. Its not easy to kill either, being tiny in hindering terrain they need a 19 to zap him. Once he's dead though Korr is just about useless.
